pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 24)

Credits English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (24 Raag Maale Gaaura) by Dr. Sant Singh Khalsa Downloaded in HTML format from www.gurbanifiles.com Converted by webmaster@ishwar.com For more sacred texts, please visit: www.ishwar.com 1

Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 001 984 : 1 Raag Maalee Gauraa, Fourth Mehl: 984 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 984 : 3 Countless have tried, but none have found the Lord's limit. 984 : 4 The Lord is inaccessible, unapproachable and unfathomable; I humbly bow to the Lord God, my King. ||1||Pause|| 984 : 5 Sexual desire, anger, greed and emotional attachment bring continual conflict and strife. 984 : 6 Save me, save me, I am your humble creature, O Lord; I have come to Your Sanctuary, O my Lord God. ||1|| 984 : 7 You protect and preserve those who take to Your Sanctuary, God; You are called the Lover of Your devotees. 984 : 8 Prahlaad, Your humble servant, was caught by Harnaakhash; but You saved Him and carried him across, Lord. ||2|| 2

984 : 9 Remember the Lord, O mind, and rise up to the Mansion of His Presence; the Sovereign Lord is the Destroyer of pain. 984 : 10 Our Lord and Master takes away the fear of birth and death; following the Guru's Teachings, the Lord God is found. ||3|| 984 : 11 The Name of the Lord, our Lord and Master, is the Purifier of sinners; I sing of the Lord, the Destroyer of the fears of His devotees. 984 : 12 One who wears the necklace of the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, in his heart, O servant Nanak, merges in the Naam. ||4||1|| 984 : 13 Maalee Gauraa, Fourth Mehl: 984 : 14 O my mind, chant the Name of the Lord, the Giver of peace. 984 : 15 One who joins the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, and enjoys the sublime taste of the Lord, as Gurmukh, comes to realize God. ||1||Pause|| 984 : 16 By great good fortune, one obtains the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan; meeting with the Guru, the Lord God is known. 984 : 17 Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 001 3

The filth of evil−mindedness is totally washed away, bathing in the Lord's ambrosial pool of nectar. ||1|| 984 : 18 Blessed, blessed are the Holy, who have found their Lord God; I ask them to tell me the stories of the Lord. 984 : 19 I fall at their feet, and always pray to them, to mercifully unite me with my Lord, the Architect of Destiny. ||2|| 984 : 20 Through the destiny written on my forehead, I have found the Holy Guru; my mind and body are imbued with the Guru's Word. 984 : 21 The Lord God has come to meet me; I have found peace, and I am rid of all the sins. ||3|| 984 : 22 Those who follow the Guru's Teachings find the Lord, the source of nectar; their words are sublime and exalted. 984 : 23 By great good fortune, one is blessed with the dust of their feet; servant Nanak falls at their feet. ||4||2|| −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 001 −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 001 4

Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 002 985 : 24 Maalee Gauraa, Fourth Mehl: 985 : 25 All the Siddhas, seekers and silent sages, with their minds full of love, meditate on the Lord. 985 : 26 The Supreme Lord God, my Lord and Master, is limitless; the Guru has inspired me to know the unknowable Lord. ||1||Pause|| 985 : 27 I am low, and I commit evil actions; I have not remembered my Sovereign Lord. 985 : 28 The Lord has led me to meet the True Guru; in an instant, He liberated me from bondage. ||1|| 985 : 29 Such is the destiny God wrote on my forehead; following the Guru's Teachings, I enshrine love for the Lord. 985 : 30 The Panch Shabad, the five primal sounds, vibrate and resound in the Court of the Lord; meeting the Lord, I sing the songs of joy. ||2|| 985 : 31 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is the Purifier of sinners; the unfortunate wretches do not like this. 5

985 : 32 They rot away in the womb of reincarnation; they fall apart like salt in water. ||3|| 985 : 33 Please bless me with such understanding, O Inaccessible Lord God, my Lord and Master, that my mind may remain attached to the Guru's feet. 985 : 34 Servant Nanak remains attached to the Name of the Lord; he is merged in the Naam. ||4||3|| 985 : 35 Maalee Gauraa, Fourth Mehl: 985 : 36 My mind is addicted to the juice of the Lord's Name. 985 : 37 My heart−lotus has blossomed forth, and I have found the Guru. Meditating on the Lord, my doubts and fears have run away. ||1||Pause|| 985 : 38 In the Fear of God, my heart is committed in loving devotion to Him; following the Guru's Teachings, my sleeping mind has awakened. 985 : 39 All my sins have been erased, and I have found peace and tranquility; I have enshrined the Lord within my heart, by great good fortune. ||1|| 985 : 40 The self−willed manmukh is like the false color of the safflower, which fades away; its color lasts for only a few days. Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 002 6

985 : 41 He perishes in an instant; he is tormented, and punished by the Righteous Judge of Dharma. ||2|| 985 : 42 The Lord's Love, found in the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, is absolutely permanent, and colorfast. 985 : 43 The cloth of the body may be torn to shreds, but still, this beautiful color of the Lord's Love does not fade away. ||3|| 985 : 44 Meeting with the Blessed Guru, one is dyed in the color of the Lord's Love, imbued with this deep crimson color. 985 : 45 Servant Nanak washes the feet of that humble being, who is attached to the feet of the Lord. ||4||4|| 985 : 46 Maalee Gauraa, Fourth Mehl: 985 : 47 O my mind, meditate, vibrate upon the Name of the Lord, the Lord of the World, Har, Har. 985 : 48 My mind and body are merged in the Lord's Name, and through the Guru's Teachings, my intellect is imbued with the Lord, the source of nectar. ||1||Pause|| 985 : 49 Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 002 7

Follow the Guru's Teachings, and meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. Chant, and meditate, on the beads of the mala of the Lord. 985 : 50 Those who have such destiny inscribed upon their foreheads, meet with the Lord, adorned with garlands of flowers. ||1|| 985 : 51 Those who meditate on the Name of the Lord − all their entanglements are ended. 985 : 52 The Messenger of Death does not even approach them; the Guru, the Savior Lord, saves them. ||2|| 985 : 53 I am a child; I know nothing at all. The Lord cherishes me, as my mother and father. 985 : 54 I continually put my hands into the fire of Maya, but the Guru saves me; He is merciful to the meek. ||3|| 985 : 55 I was filthy, but I have become immaculate. Singing the Lord's Praises, all sins have been burnt to ashes. 985 : 56 My mind is in esctasy, having found the Guru; servant Nanak is enraptured through the Word of the Shabad. ||4||5|| 985 : 57 Maalee Gauraa, Fourth Mehl: −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 002 −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 002 8
Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 002 9

Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 986 : 58 O my mind, meditate, vibrate on the Lord, and all sins will be eradicated. 986 : 59 The Guru has enshried the Lord, Har, Har, within my heart; I place my head on the Guru's Path. ||1||Pause|| 986 : 60 Whoever tells me the stories of my Lord God, I would cut my mind into slices, and dedicate it to him. 986 : 61 The Perfect Guru has united me with the Lord, my Friend; I have sold myself at each and every store for the Guru's Word. ||1|| 986 : 62 One may give donations in charity at Prayaag, and cut the body in two at Benares, 986 : 63 but without the Lord's Name, no one attains liberation, even though one may give away huge amounts of gold. ||2|| 986 : 64 When one follows the Guru's Teachings, and sings the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises, the doors of the mind, held shut by deception, are thrown open again. 986 : 65 The three qualities are shattered, doubt and fear run away, and the clay pot of public opinion is broken. ||3|| 10

986 : 66 They alone find the Perfect Guru in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, upon whose foreheads such pre−ordained destiny is inscribed. 986 : 67 Servant Nanak drinks in the Ambrosial Nectar; all his hunger and thirst are quenched. ||4||6|| 986 : 68 Set of Six Hymns 1|| 986 : 69 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 986 : 70 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 986 : 71 O mind, true peace comes from serving the Lord. 986 : 72 Other services are false, and as punishment for them, the Messenger of Death bashes in one's head. ||1||Pause|| 986 : 73 They alone join the Sangat, the Congregation, upon whose forehead such destiny is inscribed. 986 : 74 They are carried across the terrifying world−ocean by the Saints of the Infinite, Primal Lord God. ||1|| Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 11

986 : 75 Serve forever at the feet of the Holy; renounce greed, emotional attachment and corruption. 986 : 76 Abandon all other hopes, and rest your hopes in the One Formless Lord. ||2|| 986 : 77 Some are faithless cynics, deluded by doubt; without the Guru, there is only pitch darkness. 986 : 78 Whatever is pre−ordained, comes to pass; no one can erase it. ||3|| 986 : 79 The beauty of the Lord of the Universe is profound and unfathomable; the Names of the Infinite Lord are immunerable. 986 : 80 Blessed, blessed are those humble beings, O Nanak, who enshrine the Lord's Name in their hearts. ||4||1|| 986 : 81 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 986 : 82 I humbly bow to the Name of the Lord. 986 : 83 Chanting it, one is saved. ||1||Pause|| 986 : 84 Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 12

Meditating on Him in remembrance, conflicts are ended. 986 : 85 Meditating on Him, one's bonds are untied. 986 : 86 Meditating on Him, the fool becomes wise. 986 : 87 Meditating on Him, one's ancestors are saved. ||1|| 986 : 88 Meditating on Him, fear and pain are taken away. 986 : 89 Meditating on Him, misfortune is avoided. 986 : 90 Meditating on Him, sins are erased. 986 : 91 Meditating on Him, agony is ended. ||2|| 986 : 92 Meditating on Him, the heart blossoms forth. 986 : 93 Meditating on Him, Maya becomes one's slave. 986 : 94 Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 13

Meditating on Him, one is blessed with the treasures of wealth. 986 : 95 Meditating on Him, one crosses over in the end. ||3|| 986 : 96 The Name of the Lord is the Purifier of sinners. 986 : 97 It saves millions of devotees. 986 : 98 I am meek; I seek the Sanctuary of the slaves of the Lord's slaves. 986 : 99 Nanak lays his forehead on the feet of the Saints. ||4||2|| 986 : 100 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 986 : 101 This is the sort of helper the Name of the Lord is. 986 : 102 Meditating in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, one's affairs are perfectly resolved. ||1||Pause|| 986 : 103 It is like a boat to a drowning man. −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 14
Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 003 15

Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 987 : 104 It is like oil to the lamp whose flame is dying out. 987 : 105 It is like water poured on the burning fire. 987 : 106 It is like milk poured into the baby's mouth. ||1|| 987 : 107 As one's brother becomes a helper on the field of battle; 987 : 108 as one's hunger is satisfied by food; 987 : 109 as the cloudburst saves the crops; 987 : 110 as one is protected in the tiger's lair;||2|| 987 : 111 As with the magic spell of Garuda the eagle upon one's lips, one does not fear the snake; 987 : 112 as the cat cannot eat the parrot in its cage; 16

987 : 113 as the bird cherishes her eggs in her heart; 987 : 114 as the grains are spared, by sticking to the central post of the mill;||3|| 987 : 115 Your Glory is so great; I can describe only a tiny bit of it. 987 : 116 O Lord, You are inaccessible, unapproachable and unfathomable. 987 : 117 You are lofty and high, utterly great and infinite. 987 : 118 Meditating in remembrance on the Lord, O Nanak, one is carried across. ||4||3|| 987 : 119 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 987 : 120 Please let my works be rewarding and fruitful. 987 : 121 Please cherish and exalt Your slave. ||1||Pause|| 987 : 122 I lay my forehead on the feet of the Saints, Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 17

987 : 123 and with my eyes, I gaze upon the Blessed Vision of their Darshan, day and night. 987 : 124 With my hands, I work for the Saints. 987 : 125 I dedicate my breath of life, my mind and wealth to the Saints. ||1|| 987 : 126 My mind loves the Society of the Saints. 987 : 127 The Virtues of the Saints abide within my consciousness. 987 : 128 The Will of the Saints is sweet to my mind. 987 : 129 Seeing the Saints, my heart−lotus blossoms forth. ||2|| 987 : 130 I dwell in the Society of the Saints. 987 : 131 I have such a great thirst for the Saints. 987 : 132 The Words of the Saints are the Mantras of my mind. Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 18

987 : 133 By the Grace of the Saints, my corruption is taken away. ||3|| 987 : 134 This way of liberation is my treasure. 987 : 135 O Merciful God, please bless me with this gift. 987 : 136 O God, shower Your Mercy upon Nanak. 987 : 137 I have enshrined the feet of the Saints within my heart. ||4||4|| 987 : 138 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 987 : 139 He is with all; He is not far away. 987 : 140 He is the Cause of causes, ever−present here and now. ||1||Pause|| 987 : 141 Hearing His Name, one comes to life. 987 : 142 Pain is dispelled; peace and tranquility come to dwell within. Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 19

987 : 143 The Lord, Har, Har, is all treasure. 987 : 144 The silent sages serve Him. ||1|| 987 : 145 Everything is contained in His home. 987 : 146 No one is turned away empty−handed. 987 : 147 He cherishes all beings and creatures. 987 : 148 Forever and ever, serve the Merciful Lord. ||2|| 987 : 149 Righteous justice is dispensed in His Court forever. 987 : 150 He is carefree, and owes allegiance to no one. 987 : 151 He Himself, by Himself, does everything. 987 : 152 O my mind, meditate on Him. ||3|| Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 20

987 : 153 I am a sacrifice to the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy. 987 : 154 Joining them, I am saved. 987 : 155 My mind and body are attuned to the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 987 : 156 God has blessed Nanak with this gift. ||4||5|| 987 : 157 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl, Du−Padas: 987 : 158 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 987 : 159 I seek the Sanctuary of the all−powerful Lord. 987 : 160 My soul, body, wealth and capital belong to the One God, the Cause of causes. ||1||Pause|| 987 : 161 Meditating, meditating in remembrance on Him, I have found everlasting peace. He is the source of life. 987 : 162 He is all−pervading, permeating all places; He is in subtle essence and manifest form. ||1|| Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 21
−− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 004 22

Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 005 988 : 163 Abandon all your entanglements and corruption; sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord forever. 988 : 164 With palms pressed together, Nanak begs for this blessing; please bless me with Your Name. ||2||1||6|| 988 : 165 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 988 : 166 God is all−powerful, divine and infinite. 988 : 167 Who knows Your wondrous plays? You have no end or limitation. ||1||Pause|| 988 : 168 In an instant, You establish and disestablish; You create and destroy, O Creator Lord. 988 : 169 As many beings as You created, God, so many You bless with Your blessings. ||1|| 988 : 170 I have come to Your Sanctuary, Lord; I am Your slave, O Inaccessible Lord God. 988 : 171 Lift me up and pull me out of the terrifying, treacherous world−ocean; servant Nanak is 23

forever a sacrifice to You. ||2||2||7|| 988 : 172 Maalee Gauraa, Fifth Mehl: 988 : 173 The Lord of the World abides in my mind and body. 988 : 174 Friend of the meek, Lover of His devotees, forever and ever merciful. ||1||Pause|| 988 : 175 In the beginning, in the end and in the middle, You alone exist, God; there is none other than You. 988 : 176 He is totally permeating and pervading all worlds; He is the One and only Lord and Master. ||1|| 988 : 177 With my ears I hear God's Praises, and with my eyes I behold the Blessed Vision of His Darshan; with my tongue I sing the Lord's Glorious Praises. 988 : 178 Nanak is forever a sacrifice to You; please, bless me with Your Name. ||2||3||8||6||14|| 988 : 179 Maalee Gauraa, The Word Of Devotee Naam Dayv Jee: 988 : 180 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 005 24

988 : 181 Blessed, blessed is that flute which the Lord plays. 988 : 182 The sweet, sweet unstruck sound current sings forth. ||1||Pause|| 988 : 183 Blessed, blessed is the wool of the sheep; 988 : 184 blessed, blessed is the blanket worn by Krishna. ||1|| 988 : 185 Blessed, blessed are you, O mother Dayvakee; 988 : 186 into your home the Lord was born. ||2|| 988 : 187 Blessed, blessed are the forests of Brindaaban; 988 : 188 the Supreme Lord plays there. ||3|| 988 : 189 He plays the flute, and herds the cows; 988 : 190 Naam Dayv's Lord and Master plays happily. ||4||1|| Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 005 25

988 : 191 O my Father, Lord of wealth, blessed are You, long−haired, dark−skinned, my darling. ||1||Pause|| 988 : 192 You hold the steel chakra in Your hand; You came down from Heaven, and saved the life of the elephant. 988 : 193 In the court of Duhsaasan, You saved the honor of Dropati, when her clothes were being removed. ||1|| 988 : 194 You saved Ahliyaa, the wife of Gautam; how many have You purified and carried across? 988 : 195 Such a lowly outcaste as Naam Dayv has come seeking Your Sanctuary. ||2||2|| 988 : 196 Within all hearts, the Lord speaks, the Lord speaks. 988 : 197 Who else speaks, other than the Lord? ||1||Pause|| 988 : 198 Out of the same clay, the elephant, the ant, and the many sorts of species are formed. 988 : 199 In stationary life forms, moving beings, worms, moths and within each and every heart, the Lord is contained. ||1|| Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 005 26

988 : 200 Remember the One, Infinite Lord; abandon all other hopes. 988 : 201 Naam Dayv prays, I have become dispassionate and detached; who is the Lord and Master, and who is the slave? ||2||3|| −− Raag Maale Gaaura −− Raag Maale Gaaura − Part 005 27
